alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 10:10AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported snowmelt in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.8 inches are expected over the area today. This additional rain may result in broader flooding issues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Preston, Franklin, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Thatcher, Dayton, Weston, Clifton, Oxford, Riverdale, Mink Creek, Whitney, Mapleton and Emmigrant Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
